summary: Email correspondence between defense attorney Bobbi C. Sternheim and Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey regarding press briefing concerns ahead of Ghislaine Maxwell's trial. The email clarifies that Maxwell's attorneys, David Boies and Sigrid McCawley, have no intention of providing press briefings during trial and are complying with court rules.

events.title: Call Regarding Press Articles
events.description: A call took place between legal teams where articles about potential press briefings by Maxwell's attorneys were referenced.

events.title: Clarification on Press Briefings
events.description: Maurene Comey emails Bobbi Sternheim to clarify that Maxwell's attorneys have no intention of providing press briefings during the trial and are complying with court rules.

events.title: Upcoming Trial Reference
events.description: The email references 'in advance of Monday', indicating an upcoming legal proceeding or trial date for Ghislaine Maxwell.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's attorneys, David Boies and Sigrid McCawley, confirmed they have no intention of providing press briefings during her upcoming trial.
The email exchange shows coordination between defense attorney Bobbi Sternheim and prosecutor Maurene Comey regarding trial conduct and media relations.
All attorneys mentioned are confirmed to be complying with SDNY Local Rule 23.1 regarding public statements during trial.
The communication occurred in late November 2021, just before Maxwell's trial was set to begin.
